author: A_Brickset_user
title: Very cool toa.
review: Onewa comes in second place to nuju but is just as cool. He has thirteen points of articulation, the most in a bionicle set. He is a middle sized toa ( not as tall as nuju or nokama but not as short as whenua ). His tools are very dourable and not easy to break. A much better impovement to pohatu. If you like bionicle, I highly suggest to get this toa.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Review for 8604 Onewa
review:
This is a great Toa. He has 13 points of movement, a very cool mask in my opinion, and there are many new pieces for Bonicle MOC builders to use. The only thing that bugs me is the weopon. It looks way too weak to me once i test the set.. then I will know.. :P

10/10.

author: hedgehog_lover
title: Onewa, the overgrown hammer swinger
review:
this is a great set, as are all of the toa metru, but is very hard to find now.

Pros-
cool weapons
awsome mask
love the armour and colour

cons-
any ideas?

buy if-you like the toa or want a great set.
don't buy if-erm?

5/5

author: saberbreaker
title: onewa
review: onewa was a good set back in 2004  but his proto piton broke too easily because as soon as i took them out out of his canister they almost broke i liked the new brown colour back then instead of the yellow sets actualy i liked the brown sets better than the other colours.but i only got him of the toa metru

author: Gus_263
title: This toa of stone rocks
review: Onewa is the first of my metru. He is so cool, and have gear functions. The proto pitons and the mask have a awesome design for toa of the stone. The colors aren't the same of various bionicles, and it is a obstacle to make upgrades and creations. Another problem is th eyes. The original toa of stone eyes were orange,not dark blue.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: I Got Him From Bricklink!
review:
I've always like Toa Metru, and this guy is no exception.  I like his Proton Piston tools; they can be used as grapnels to climb you dresser ;).  His eyes are dark blue and his head is gray, like the others'.  His mask looks neat, and he looks more than a match for fifty Vahki!  Here's the stats for Toa Metru Onewa:

Pros:

-Proton Piston tools

-Mask of Mind Control looks awesome

-Dark blue eyes

-Toa Metru just rock

-Can climb up your dresser :D

Cons:

-None!!

Go get Onewa (with Nokama)!!  You won't regret it, believe you me!!

author: Carl
title: Cool but....
review:
I've always been a fan of the brown Bionicles. I think that Pohatu and Pohatu Nuva were awesome. Especially Pohatu Nuva. But this guy was kinda of a let down. 

Pros:
Colour
Cool armour
Feet

Cons:
Mask
String-like weapons

I know that there aren't many cons but they are really bad cons so that is why Onewa gets a 2/5.

author: greshmalum
title: onewa, master carver!
review:
My little brother and I share my Brickset account and he bought this awesome set off eBay for a great price. 

PROS-

rare armor
only-in-this-set-weapons
rare mask

CONS-

I don't like the arm gears, but I can take them out except my brother won't let me and you know what that means- '''MOM, HE [I won't put my real name] IS PLAYING WITH MY DUDE!''' And then I get in trouble.

author: Alemas
title: Great Onewa!
review:
Onewa is very cool-looking, as it has twin stone tools, a gear on the back that swings the arms back and forth, cool mask, and bending legs! The bending legs were a first in 2004 for Bionicle, as they had fixed legs!

Pros:

Stone tools
Cool mask
Bending legs
Swinging arms

Cons:

None!

Overall, a great set!

author: dk_devilkid
title: Odd looking mask but good
review: Onewa is good but my least favorite toa. His weapons are cool but his mask is ugly. When I am putting my bionicle on a shelf or something I always like to have him hanging on something to give him a more "Onewa" feel. If he is the only bionicle at the store get him. But if they have any others get them first.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Metru) - Onewa Review
review:
This is a cool figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 44 pieces and it was 8 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 18 cents per piece when it was on sale which is a good value for what we get here.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/bionicle/8604/l/8604-001.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On the back of the figure are two weapons which looks really cool. I really like this figure and I also like the design of this mask.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: james3426
title: Onewa, the climber.
review:
This is a set is a good way of getting rare colored pieces. My favorite type of piece here has to be the shoulder armor, or the torso. The weapons are cool too, but they are so easily bent. On mine, they are bent, but still not broken. The Great Komau, mask of mind control is a cool mask with the big eye hole. The gear system is my favorite part because, it looks like he is digging when he is swinging his arms.

Pros:
Nice mask.
Cool shoulder armor.
Awesome swinging arms.
Cool weapons.
Nice colors.

A great Toa for anyone. Get this if you get the chance.

author: chavez365
title: Really Cool!
review:
Onewa is my only Toa Metru(for now!), and he has not disappointed. He has two very cool weapons that are like special pickaxes. Then he has a very neat mask with two awesome blue eyes. He matches his element well, because there basically only brown on him, and he is a Toa of Earth. Here are the pros and cons.
Pros:
Mask
Weapons
Matches element well
Has cool blue eyes
Cons:
Weapons are bendy, so they could break.
Onewa is really awesome, and I think is perfect as a starter for the Metru.

author: BrickBuiltBill
title: It'd be easier to list off what they DIDN'T get right.
review: As the title implies, I have a sort of bias regarding Constraction, which becomes a moot point since this figure came before my Bionicle phase. Even with this clean slate, I still have nothing but good things to say about Onewa! Well, except maybe the possibility of his "Proto Pitons" becoming warped. Still, tender love and care can prevent that. One thing I've observed is that a number of factors give him a mountain climber-esque feel: The general shape of his Kanohi mask, the aforementioned Pitons, and, of course, the fact that he's the Toa of Stone. Would definitely recommend picking up if the price is right.
